required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Benefits of a Prehabilitation Program : Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Benefits of a Program of Prehabilitation: Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The process of enhancing functional capacity of the individual in anticipation of an upcoming stressor has been termed "prehabilitation". In the present pilot trial, the impact of a multimodal prehabilitation intervention composed of exercise, nutritional supplement and psychological well-being begun in the preoperative period will be evaluated.

arm_group.description: Multimodal prehabilitation intervention composed of exercise, nutritional supplement and psychological well-being

intervention.description: multimodal prehabilitation intervention composed of exercise, nutritional supplement and psychological well-being

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 18 years old
- Affiliated with a social security system
- Having indicated their non-opposition
- Must undergo a surgical intervention within a period of at least one month after the completion of the initial inclusion assessment and / or chemotherapy and / or radiotherapy
Non-inclusion criteria:
- Refusal of participation
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
- Inability to walk or initial physical assessment
- Patient under guardianship or curatorship
- Inability to complete questionnaires
Exclusion criteria:
- Cognitive disorders detected by the geriatric consultation
- Lost
- Death before surgery or chemotherapy or radiotherapy
- Shortened preoperative preparation time (<18 days)
